text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in Norwegian papers this morning:
-Since 1987 the left-wing party, Sosialistisk Venstreparti, has gained increased support from immigrants. The Conservatives and the right-wing party have experienced declining votes.
-Labour Union leader Yngve Haagensen asks the government to take action to weaken the strong Norwegian crown.
-The Labour Union wants workers to have an extra week of vacation. Currently Norwegians have four weeks' holiday per year.
-Norway's Export Council advises Norwegian companies to use the Internet to increase sales to the United States.

-Metals producer Elkem has entered negotiations to take over Iceland's alloy maker Icelandic Alloy. Elkem Manager Ole Enger says the company needs to move production abroad because of a lack of power in Norway.
